intro: Erodium mauritanicum, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from spring to summer, followed by small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Erodium mauritanicum is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common weed in agricultural and urban areas.
